net.sf.mmm.client.ui.api.widget.complex

Interface UiWidgetListTable<ROW>

  • Type Parameters:
    ROW - is the generic type of a row in the value list.
    All Superinterfaces:
    AbstractValidatableObject, Accessibility, AttributeReadAriaRole, AttributeReadDisposed, AttributeReadEditable, AttributeReadEnabled, AttributeReadHtmlId, AttributeReadId<String>, AttributeReadMode, AttributeReadModeFixed, AttributeReadModified, AttributeReadPrimaryStyle, AttributeReadSelectedValue<ROW>, AttributeReadSelectionMode, AttributeReadStringTitle, AttributeReadStyles, AttributeReadStylesAdvanced, AttributeReadSummary, AttributeReadTitle<String>, AttributeReadTitleVisible, AttributeReadTooltip, AttributeReadValue<List<ROW>>, AttributeReadValueAdvanced<List<ROW>>, AttributeReadVisible, AttributeReadVisibleRecursive, AttributeWriteDisposed, AttributeWriteEditable, AttributeWriteEnabled, AttributeWriteHtmlId, AttributeWriteId<String>, AttributeWriteMode, AttributeWriteModeFixed, AttributeWritePrimaryStyle, AttributeWriteSelectedValue<ROW>, AttributeWriteSelectionMode, AttributeWriteStringTitle, AttributeWriteStyles, AttributeWriteStylesAdvanced, AttributeWriteSummary, AttributeWriteTitle<String>, AttributeWriteTitleVisible, AttributeWriteTooltip, AttributeWriteValue<List<ROW>>, AttributeWriteValueAdvanced<List<ROW>>, AttributeWriteVisible, AttributeWriteVisibleAdvanced, HasValueValidators<List<ROW>>, UiFeature, UiFeatureEvent, UiFeatureMessages, UiFeatureMode, UiFeatureSelectedValue<ROW>, UiFeatureValidation<List<ROW>>, UiFeatureValue<List<ROW>>, UiFeatureValueAndValidation<List<ROW>>, UiWidget, UiWidgetAbstractDataSet<ROW>, UiWidgetAbstractDataTable<ROW>, UiWidgetAbstractListTable<ROW>, UiWidgetAbstractWithValue<List<ROW>>, UiWidgetListBase<ROW>, UiWidgetListContainer<ROW>, UiWidgetNative, UiWidgetRegular, UiWidgetWithSelectedValue<ROW>, UiWidgetWithValue<List<ROW>>, ValidatableObject<List<ROW>>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractUiWidgetListTable, UiWidgetCustomListTable, UiWidgetListTableGwt

    public interface UiWidgetListTable<ROW>
extends UiWidgetAbstractListTable<ROW>, UiWidgetNative
    This is the interface for a normal list table widget. Its value is the actual list that is displayed and may be modified by the end-user. For a general feature list see UiWidgetAbstractDataTable.
    ATTENTION:
    For small modifications of the list content please use the dedicated methods (UiWidgetAbstractListTable.addRow(Object, int), UiWidgetAbstractListTable.removeRow(Object), etc.) as they are a lot more efficient than AttributeWriteValueAdvanced.setValue(Object, boolean).
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

    • Method Detail

      • getValue

        List<ROW> getValue()
        Here the value is the actual list that is displayed and may be modified (edited, rows added or removed, etc.) by the end-user. This method gets the value of this object. This will typically be a newly created object.
        ATTENTION:
        If the current value entered by the user can NOT be parsed, this method will catch and ignore the exception and return null instead. If you want to do validation and give feedback to the user please use AttributeReadValueAdvanced.getValueOrException(Object) instead. However, there are higher-level ways to do this such as getValueAndValidate.
        IMPORTANT:
        To prevent problems with undesired modifications of values there is a general copy on get strategy. This way you can set values and allow them to be modified in the UI without side-effects on the original value. This is especially important for composite custom widgets (e.g. editors) to allow the user to modify business entities and modifications can still be cancelled and changed will be reverted. All objects that are (potentially) modified by the widgets will be copied. Therefore it is even safe to modify the result of this method in most cases. However, tree widgets build an excuse and use a copy on set/retrieve strategy.
        Specified by:
        getValue in interface AttributeReadValue<List<ROW>>
        Specified by:
        getValue in interface AttributeReadValueAdvanced<List<ROW>>
        Specified by:
        getValue in interface UiWidgetWithValue<List<ROW>>
        Returns:
        the value of this object. May be null unless otherwise stated.
